intro: Soulangia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered soulangia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with simple, opposite leaves. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native range.
